title: Drawing, 1750–75
medium: Pen and ink on laid paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The masts are shown at one side. The ornaments are at the other. A calyx as a central motif between branch scrolls and in opposite directions, two crossed shepherds’ staffs with a wreath “a” is written above and there are two crossed branches with a stick with a lion mask. Leaves and part of a window frame are sketched in graphite.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, 1750–75. Pen and ink on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-494.
